metadata.title: CVE-2024-1554 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium
metadata.description: The `fetch()` API and navigation incorrectly shared the same cache, as thecache key did not include the optional headers `fetch()` may contain.Under the correct circumstances, an attacker may have been able to poisonthe local browser cache by priming it with a `fetch()` response controlledby the additional headers. Upon navigation to the same URL, the user wouldsee the cached response instead of the expected response. Thisvulnerability affects Firefox < 123.

criterions.comment: firefox: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
thunderbird: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
mozjs38: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
mozjs52: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
